alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 6:58PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Yuma and northwestern Dundy Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 656 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking outflow from severe thunderstorm 5 miles west of Pleasant Valley, or 6 miles east of Holyoke, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These strong winds may occur with little or no precipitation. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Yuma and northwestern Dundy Counties, including the following locations... Alvin and Wauneta. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 257 and 270. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado...and southwestern Nebraska.
